answers.answer: Either that or you'll be having a big baby.
If you're measuring ahead, chances are you'll have them early.

I'm measuring 3 weeks ahead, are you being sent for a growth scan? I have one this week, my midwife said it could either be dates are out which would mean baby's due date changes from June 1st to may 11th, or if it's lots of fluid I have to have the glucose test to see if it's gestational diabetes although she's doubtful as I have no family history of it. I think it could just be the way the baby is laying. Will post again after growth scan x

Measuring ahead and a big baby doesn't necessarily mean the baby will be early. I measured ahead with my first and she was born 2 weeks late at 9lbs 3. I was convinced I'd go early but it was not to be. :)

My first I always measured early and they had to induce me at 38 weeks in fear she would be too big. She was born at 7 lbs 11 oz 2 weeks early. She would had been huge if she was on time. Ugh it was had enough to push her out

They checked my fluid and they said its perfect and my glucose levels are ok . I had a miscarriage before I got pregnant with this baby and my period was irregular can this be the cause of measuring ahead?  Im not worried neither the dc im just curious .
Slightly off topic, but does anyone know how they know how big baby is? I'm 27 weeks but no one has ever told me how big our baby is, I'm just curious how I can find out.
They can estimate baby weight via ultrasound...But typically they are measuring your uterus size, which if I'm not mistaken should match up with the number weeks pregnant you are.
They usually get the weight from ultrasound measurements
U could just be in line to have a big baby some women just have big babies

question: And baby is 3 pounds and 4 oz whats does that mean? Can I have my baby ealier than my due date ? Due jun 7 but I have a feeling ill have her by the end of may
title: doc said im measuring 2 wks and half ahead
